answers.answer: Try posting on the sister forum, "Ask A Doctor". Dr Ramsetty may have better guidance for you than us patients. This is a patient to patient forum although, at times, we have medical students/Interns/Doctors stopping by to briefly lay their input.

question: Dear Doctor,I am a 37 year old woman, 5'0 115 lbs.  I was recently diagnosed with type 2 diabetes ( I know physically I do not fit the mold, bad genetics) after several years of dodging it.  I have three children and with all three pregnancies I had gestational diabetes and was on insulin all three times from the beginning of my pregnancies.  I have tried Metformin 1000 mg a day it makes me extremely ill.  Switched to Actos, felt great, then started having chest pain and twitching feeling in heart, switched to glipizide 5mg kept having severe drops in blood sugar dropping to 50 at one point, i am not a big eater prefer small meals throughout the day and i have a good diet, switched back to and currently taking metformin trying half pills throughout the day still same issue feel like i have the stomach flu everyday, my numbers are sort of all over the place, with my fastings are the most troublesome always on the high side 130-195. I am very sensitive to almost all meds and tend to just suffer with pain etc., instead of taking medsm however, i realize i do need diabetes med. can't go untreated.  (Big Picture) I have suffered from anxiety and migraines most of my adult life.  In recent years (past 5) I have been suffering from widespread muscular pain (myofacial pain syndrome) according to rheumatologist, cannot sit or stand for very long without pain in neck and back, have difficulty holding a pen or typing due to pain in hands and wrists, ankles and tops of feet hurt, wake up with pain all over, chronic fatigue, shortness of breath, dizzines, ringing in my ears, eye pain, occasional numbness and tingling in my hands and feet, hot flashes, memory loss, difficulty with attention span and word recall difficulty. Not sure how this relates but, I had my tsh checked several months and had a low tsh with normal t3 and t4.  It was re-checked and they were all normal.  I insisted on having it checked again due to recent extreme fatigue,so tired it hurts...and new levels are as follows:last cholesteral 196last a1c 5.8iron slightly lowtsh .25t3   2.96t4 1.01ultrasound results: mildly heterogenous in echotexture without sonographically detectable focal lesions. right lobe 4.5x1.9x1.7cm, left lobe 3.4x1.4x1.5c.,isthmus is normal in calibur 3mm, no evidence of adenopathy, no extrathyroidal mass identified.Do you have any explanation? Waiting to have first appt. with an Endo., but a month away.Thank you in advance for your time."
title: Medications make me sick
